name: 兒童英語教學
description: This course intends to familiarize students with both theoretical and pedagogical knowledge to teach young children. A varieties of teaching activities and techniques suitable for children will be introduced. Each week, the class will discuss a specific topic related to teaching English to young learners. In this course, students will have opportunities to design activities as well as conduct relevant child or class observations to facilitate the learning process and deepen the understanding of class materials.
goals: 1.	to familiarize students with major principles, teaching techniques and types of activities for teaching children.
to provide opportunities for students to practice designing teaching activities and utilizing authentic materials based on learners’ individual profiles and needs.
syllabus:
Week 1 Introduction and orientation

Week 2 Teaching English to young learners around the world: an introduction

Week 3 Basic principles of teaching English to young learners (TEYL)

Week 4 Contextualizing instruction: creating thematic units and lesson plans

Week 5 Teaching listening

Week 6 Teaching speaking

Week 7 Teaching reading 

Week 8 Teaching writing

Week 9 Midterm presentation I 

Week 10 Midterm presentation II

Week 11 Storytelling

Week 12 Assessment 

Week 13 Classroom management

Week 14 Twenty-first-century skills in teaching English to young learners (TEYL)

Week 15 Professional development

Week 16 Review and discussion of current TEYL issues in Taiwan

Week 17 Final presentation I 

Week 18 Final presentation II

methodologies.note: Problem-based learning from the questions raised in class
Collaborative learning among students from the class activities
Multimedia resources used to enhance understanding
Individual project relevant to student's interest
